title: Chinese Solar Greenhouse over PTES - Detailed Technical Cross Section v3
subtitle: Enklava Project | Łódź, Poland | 100% Solar Heating for 4 Houses
scene_description: Ultra-detailed technical cross-section of a Chinese passive solar greenhouse built directly above an underground Pit Thermal Energy Storage (PTES) constructed from PREFAB CONCRETE TANKS. View is from the EAST looking WEST, showing the full north-south span. The section reveals all construction layers with photorealistic materials and accurate proportions. Background shows Polish winter landscape with snow.

overall_dimensions.total_height: 5.5m from pit bottom to greenhouse peak
overall_dimensions.viewing_angle: true horizontal cross-section, no perspective distortion

critical_visual_emphasis.instruction: Show VERTICAL (90°) concrete walls - NOT SLOPED. Gray concrete with visible LIGHT BLUE XPS insulation on the OUTSIDE. Show joint lines where tank modules connect. The walls go STRAIGHT UP from floor to lid.
Draw THICK BLACK LINE (5-8px) ONLY on top of concrete lids, NOT on vertical walls. The prefab concrete tanks are already waterproof - EPDM serves only as vapor barrier on top surface.
Show as EMPTY SPACE 200mm high between black EPDM line and timber joists. Use light background color to emphasize emptiness. Add small air circulation arrows.
Show dark blue/black flat plate collectors MOUNTED ON INTERIOR FACE of north wall. They face south INTO the greenhouse. Include copper pipe connections.
Show ORANGE PEX PIPES in serpentine pattern embedded in the clay plaster layer of north wall interior. These are SEPARATE from the solar collectors.
Show rolled-up insulating blanket as a VISIBLE CYLINDER at the top of the glazing, positioned on the OUTER/EXTERIOR side of the polycarbonate. Include deployment tracks on outside.
Show 2-3 people INSIDE the greenhouse working with plants - tending tomatoes, harvesting greens, natural gardening activities. Light clothing (warm inside). Provides human scale.
Show 2-3 people OUTSIDE near houses in winter activities - carrying firewood, shoveling snow, walking. Warm winter clothing. Creates contrast with warm greenhouse.
Show beams spanning the FULL WIDTH from north to south, resting on top of vertical concrete tank walls. NO POSTS INSIDE THE TANKS.

legend_box.title: SYSTEM SPECIFICATIONS
content: Tank type: Gozmak prefab concrete 10m³ modules
Tank walls: B25 reinforced concrete, 100mm, VERTICAL

info_box.title: KEY INNOVATIONS
content: ✓ VERTICAL walls - no excavation slopes needed
✓ Factory waterproofed - no on-site EPDM welding
✓ Greenhouse heated FREE by PTES below
✓ EPDM ceiling seals vapor from timber
✓ No heat pump needed - direct solar to water

technical_notes: Prefab tanks: Gozmak custom (3.0m × 2.4m × 3.0m HEIGHT), B25 concrete, 100mm walls
Tank waterproofing: Double sealed, factory pressure-tested 100% leak-tight
XPS insulation: 100mm on exterior of concrete walls (R-value ~2.5 m²K/W)
Glulam beams GL28h rated for 8.5m span with 5kN/m² load
EPDM lifetime 50+ years, UV stabilized - on TOP surface only
Polycarbonate R-value: 1.8 (16mm triple) + EXTERIOR blanket = R-8 at night
Thermal blanket deploys on OUTSIDE of glazing for night insulation

generation_instructions.lighting: Winter daylight from south, warm glow from water storage
generation_instructions.detail_level: Maximum - show all construction layers clearly
generation_instructions.label_clarity: All labels LARGE, READABLE, high contrast
generation_instructions.emphasis: Make VERTICAL concrete tank walls, XPS insulation, and EPDM top seal the most visible elements in the underground portion
generation_instructions.human_element: IMPORTANT: Include people both INSIDE greenhouse (gardening in light clothes) and OUTSIDE near houses (winter clothes). This adds life and shows the contrast between warm interior and cold exterior.
avoid: Do NOT show sloped pit walls - walls must be VERTICAL (90°)
Do NOT show EPDM liner on vertical walls - only on top/ceiling
Do NOT show posts or supports inside the water/tank volume
Do NOT merge wall heating and wall collectors into one element
Do NOT skip the air gap between EPDM and timber
Do NOT make the concrete walls look like earth/soil - they are GRAY CONCRETE
Do NOT put thermal blanket BETWEEN polycarbonate layers - it goes on the OUTSIDE
Do NOT forget to include people in the scene
Do NOT make the south glazing FLAT - it MUST be a PARABOLIC CURVE
Do NOT use straight roof panels - the glazing curves smoothly like a ski jump
Do NOT use a gable roof or shed roof - use CHINESE GREENHOUSE parabolic shape
